headline: Coinpedia Digest: This Week‚Äôs Crypto News Highlights | 19 July, 2025
summary: The post Coinpedia Digest: This Week‚Äôs Crypto News Highlights | 19 July, 2025 appeared first on Coinpedia Fintech News Big week for crypto and a big one for regulation! The U.S is making fast decisions, Ripple vs SEC is back to make headlines, and fresh momentum built around some of the industry‚Äôs biggest tokens. There‚Äôs policy, price action, and just enough controversy to keep things interesting. If you missed anything, don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì I‚Äôve put the key updates in one place. Let‚Äôs dive in. #1 Gamechanger for Crypto? GENIUS Act Is Now Official It‚Äôs official: the U.S. just passed its first real stablecoin law. The GENIUS Act, a long-awaited bill to regulate dollar-backed stablecoins, was signed into law by President Trump after clearing the House with bipartisan support (308-122). The new rules require stablecoins to be backed by liquid assets like U.S. dollars and short-term Treasuries, with monthly public reserve disclosures. Trump called it ‚Äúa giant step to cement the American dominance of global finance and crypto technology.‚Äù It‚Äôs the clearest signal yet that stablecoins are going mainstream; now with rules to match. #2 Trump to Allow 401(k) Investments in Crypto, Gold, and Private Equity Donald Trump is preparing to open up America‚Äôs $9 trillion retirement savings market to crypto, gold, and private equity. A new executive order, expected this week, would push regulators to clear the way for 401(k) plans to include alternative investments, not just stocks and bonds. The White House says Trump is focused on ‚Äúrestoring prosperity for everyday Americans.‚Äù It‚Äôs also a major win for crypto, coming after Trump backed multiple digital asset bills and rolled back restrictions on crypto in retirement accounts. #3 SC Becomes First Global Bank to Offer Regulated BTC, ETH Trading Standard Chartered just became the first global bank to offer spot trading for Bitcoin and Ethereum. The service, rolled out via its UK subsidiary, is aimed squarely at institutions. Clients can now trade BTC and ETH on the same system they already use for currencies. This is part of a much bigger strategy that‚Äôs been years in the making, from Zodia Custody to Libeara. As CEO Bill Winters put it: ‚ÄúDigital assets are a fundamental part of the evolution of financial services.‚Äù #4 No Surprise, But No Relief: CPI at 2.7% in June June‚Äôs inflation data came out this week. Consumer prices in the U.S. rose 0.3% from May, pushing the annual inflation rate to 2.7%, the highest since February. Core inflation (excluding food and energy) held steady at 2.9% year-over-year, in line with forecasts. That might sound mild, but it‚Äôs enough to keep the Fed cautious. Some categories, like household goods and electronics, saw sharp price jumps, likely reflecting new tariffs. The takeaway is that rate cuts are still likely, but probably not before September. Bitcoin reacted with a quick drop but steadied itself. #5 ‚Çπ1,500 Cr in XRP Moved Before WazirX Hack ‚Äì Coinpedia Investigates A viral tweet from anonymous user @TOOFAANARMY is raising eyebrows: over ‚Çπ1,500 crore worth of XRP was moved from a WazirX-linked wallet just before the platform‚Äôs ‚Çπ2,000 crore hack. WazirX CEO Nischal Shetty tells Coinpedia it was routine user activity and cold wallet consolidation, not unusual. ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt have an account with Binance,‚Äù he added, pushing back on claims of direct transfers. The wallet was public on their Proof of Reserves page. For now, the claim remains unverified. #6 Grayscale Starts Process to Go Public The crypto investment firm has filed a confidential draft registration with the U.S. SEC, signaling plans for an IPO. For now, details like the number of shares and pricing are still undecided. The move won‚Äôt go forward until the SEC review is complete and market conditions are right. By choosing a confidential filing, Grayscale keeps its early plans private while testing investor interest behind the scenes. If the IPO goes ahead, it could help the company reach more investors and grow its role in traditional finance. #7 Crypto Market Cap Nears $4T, Chasing Nvidia Crypto had a massive day on Friday! The total market cap inched close to $4 trillion, driven by sharp gains in Ethereum and XRP after the U.S. House passed three major crypto bills. Bitcoin crossed $120,000 again, but ETH jumped 8% to hit $3,600, and XRP soared 20% to a new yearly high of $3.64. Binance‚Äôs CoinMarketCap puts total market cap at $3.8T, while TradingView shows $3.9T ‚Äì higher than the last peak in December. As LVRG‚Äôs Nick Ruck put it, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre optimistic‚Ä¶ as institutions race to advance integration with the crypto industry.‚Äù #8 Ripple vs. SEC Drags On Despite $125M Settlement Ripple has paid the full $125 million SEC penalty and it was all in cash, not XRP. That clears up recent rumours about a crypto payout. Former SEC lawyer Marc Fagel confirmed the court required a cash-only settlement. But the lawsuit isn‚Äôt over yet. Both Ripple and the SEC still need to withdraw their appeals before the case officially closes. Until then, the money stays locked in escrow. They already paid in cash. Sorry. ‚Äî Marc Fagel (@Marc_Fagel) July 16, 2025 Meanwhile, XRP has jumped 29% this week and is trading above $3.15, showing strong momentum. #9 Bitcoin Beats Gold as 2025‚Äôs Top Asset Bitcoin finally stole the crown! With a $123,000 price peak this week and a 30% year-to-date surge, BTC overtook gold to become 2025‚Äôs best-performing asset. But behind the breakout is a far deeper signal. As Charlie Bilello put it, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve never seen these two in the number one and number two spots.‚Äù When Bitcoin and gold lead together, it might seem optimistic but it‚Äôs warning signs. People are scared and running to shelter. Something to think about‚Ä¶ #10 Cross-Chain Crime Tripled Since 2023, Says Elliptic Crypto crime is getting harder to stop and bigger in size. A new report from Elliptic shows criminals moved over $21.8 billion through DEXs, cross-chain bridges, and swap tools this year ‚Äì three times more than in 2023. Around $2.5 billion is linked to North Korean hackers, with another $300 million tied to Iranian services under U.S. sanctions. One in three investigations now involve more than three blockchains. As scams and laundering move across networks, Elliptic says full-chain visibility is the only way to keep up. In the Spotlight Here‚Äôs a few quick hits you shouldn‚Äôt miss! Citi Joins the Stablecoin Race: Jane Fraser confirms the bank is exploring its own digital token, with crypto custody and tokenized deposits also on the table amid new support from Trump‚Äôs Genius Act and relaxed Fed rules. PUMP Token Raises $600M in 12 Minutes: Solana-based platform Pump.fun launched its memecoin with explosive demand, triggering high-volume trading and speculation across spot and derivatives markets as traders scramble for exposure during the token‚Äôs distribution phase. Trump Denies Plan to Fire Fed Chair Powell: Despite reports of a draft termination letter, Trump says he‚Äôs ‚Äúhighly unlikely‚Äù to remove Jerome Powell , unless it‚Äôs over fraud, but criticism of rate policies continues to mount. El Salvador‚Äôs Bitcoin Holdings Top $760M: Despite past criticism, the country‚Äôs BTC stash has tripled in 2025, with over 6,200 coins now worth more than $760 million as Bitcoin pushes new all-time highs. DOJ Ends Polymarket Probe in Win for Crypto Bets: The betting platform is no longer under investigation by U.S. regulators, after months of scrutiny following the 2024 election and an FBI raid on CEO Shayne Coplan‚Äôs home. What‚Äôs Next for Crypto? Major shifts to expect ahead Stablecoins may move further into the financial mainstream, now backed by real rules, real reserves and the biggest banks watching closely. Institutional crypto access could widen fast if Trump‚Äôs 401(k) order goes through, bringing billions in retirement capital into play. As inflation lingers and rate cuts stall, markets may stay jumpy but crypto‚Äôs momentum suggests traders are betting big on a September pivot. The GENIUS Act‚Äôs ripple effect is already visible, with Citi and Standard Chartered both pushing deeper into tokenized finance. Regulators face pressure to keep up with crypto crime and increasingly complex laundering tactics. That‚Äôs all for now but the next shake-up is never far in crypto. Catch you next week!

headline: Strategy (MSTR) will be the ‚Äògreatest shorting opportunity of a lifetime‚Äô, warns expert
summary: Economist Henrik Zeberg has cautioned that Strategy (NASDAQ: MSTR ), formerly known as MicroStrategy stock, might implode due to its exposure to Bitcoin ( BTC ). According to Zeberg, the stock could soon present ‚Äúthe greatest shorting opportunity,‚Äù he said in an X post on July 18. #MSTR will be the greatest shorting opportunity of a life time! Not yet! But it is coming ‚Äî Henrik Zeberg (@HenrikZeberg) July 18, 2025 Zeberg cautioned that Strategy‚Äôs deep exposure to Bitcoin may eventually crash its balance sheet, stating that every time a company adds Bitcoin to its treasury, it ‚Äúplants a small bomb‚Äù in its financials. He argued that the risk isn‚Äôt if Bitcoin tumbles again, but when. According to Zeberg, such a scenario could damage not only Strategy‚Äôs market capitalization but also its cash flow, access to credit, and investor confidence. ‚ÄúEvery time a company adds Bitcoin to its treasury, it plants a small bomb in its balance sheet. Not if BTC tumbles again ‚Äî but when ‚Äî those bombs go off. And when they do, they don‚Äôt just dent the market cap. They hit cash flow, credit lines, and confidence,‚Äù he added. It‚Äôs worth noting that Strategy‚Äôs pivot toward Bitcoin has been led by executive chairman Michael Saylor, who doubled down on his conviction, claiming that ‚Äúthe only thing better than Bitcoin is more Bitcoin.‚Äù Saylor‚Äôs bet has so far paid off, with the stock having surged approximately 3,500% over the past five years, outperforming Bitcoin‚Äôs 905% rise over the same period. MSTR short interest rising But while Strategy continues to outpace both Bitcoin and traditional market benchmarks, short sellers are taking notice. According to the latest data retrieved from Fintel by Finbold on July 19, short volume in MSTR has risen significantly. On July 18, 2025, short volume stood at 3.76 million shares out of a total trading volume of 6.74 million, resulting in a short volume ratio of 55.7%, the highest in the past ten trading days. Short interest has remained elevated throughout the period, with ratios consistently above 47% on most days, suggesting mounting bearish sentiment. MSTR short volume. Source: Fintel Meanwhile, MSTR stock is showing weakness in the short term, having ended the last trading session down over 6% to $423.22. Year-to-date, the stock has gained over 40%. MSTR YTD stock price chart. Source: Finbold Although there are concerns about Strategy‚Äôs Bitcoin plan, the company continues to add more of the asset, currently holding 601,550 BTC at an average purchase price of $66,384. Featured image via Shutterstock. The post Strategy (MSTR) will be the ‚Äògreatest shorting opportunity of a lifetime‚Äô, warns expert appeared first on Finbold .

headline: Financial Giant Charles Schwab Launching Bitcoin and Ethereum Trading, Taking Competition to Coinbase
summary: Financial services giant Charles Schwab could soon roll out Bitcoin ( BTC ) and Ethereum ( ETH ) trading, according to the firm‚Äôs chief executive. Charles Schwab CEO Rick Wurster says in a new interview with CNBC that they want to expand services for their clients, who are already significantly invested in crypto. ‚ÄúOur clients hold more than 20% of the exchange-traded product crypto in the entire industry, so they‚Äôre invested. It‚Äôs still only about $25 billion out of the $10.8 trillion that our clients have, so it‚Äôs still relatively small, but our clients own a big part of the market. We also anticipate launching Bitcoin and Ether sometime soon so our clients have access to that, and we think that‚Äôll be an acceleration of our growth, because what we hear from many of our clients are that they have 98% of their wealth here at Schwab, and they might hold a percent or 2% at some digital native firm to hold their crypto, and they really want to bring it back to Schwab because they trust us, they want it to sit alongside their other assets, and so we think we‚Äôll see some real growth when we bring those to market.‚Äù When asked if they plan to compete directly with Coinbase, Wurster responded , ‚ÄúAbsolutely.‚Äù Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Don't Miss a Beat ‚Äì Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. headline: Blackrock Big Move, Purchases 4,225 Bitcoin And 113,586 Ethereum In Fresh Accumulation
summary: BlackRock steps up its crypto game. The world‚Äôs largest asset manager snaps up 4,225‚ÄØBTC and 113,586‚ÄØETH in one decisive move. The Bitcoin haul is worth $499‚ÄØmillion. Ethereum adds $406‚ÄØmillion to the tally. This marks a turning point. Institutional demand for top‚Äëtier digital assets just went mainstream. Bitcoin Purchase and Ethereum Accumulation BlackRock secures 4,225‚ÄØBTC. That equals about $499‚ÄØmillion at today‚Äôs price of $118,408 per coin (market cap: $2.36‚ÄØtrillion). Bitcoin sits atop the crypto hierarchy. It trades as a digital store of value. This buy signals unshaken confidence in its long‚Äëterm outlook. BLACKROCK BUYS 4,225 BITCOIN AND 113,586 ETHEREUM IN MASSIVE ACCUMULATION BlackRock has purchased 4,225 BTC worth $499 million and 113,586 ETH valued at $406 million, significantly expanding its crypto portfolio. The move highlights intensifying institutional interest in both‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/wI6hDL3DNs ‚Äî Crypto Town Hall (@Crypto_TownHall) July 19, 2025 The firm also grabs 113,586‚ÄØETH. At $3,558.82 each (market cap: $429.6‚ÄØbillion), that stake totals roughly $406‚ÄØmillion. Ether fuels smart contracts and decentralized finance. BlackRock‚Äôs move shows they see programming power next to store‚Äëof‚Äëvalue appeal. Big players now treat crypto as core holdings. Hedge funds, pensions, and endowments chase yield and diversification. They view Bitcoin and Ethereum as inflation hedges. They see them as growth drivers. BlackRock‚Äôs step amplifies the trend. AUM Climbs to $12.5‚ÄØTrillion in Q2‚ÄØ2025 Crypto isn‚Äôt BlackRock‚Äôs only story. Its total assets under management soar to $12.5‚ÄØtrillion by Q2‚ÄØ2025. That reflects a compounded annual growth rate of 19% since 1995. The firm‚Äôs reach spans equities, bonds, real estate,and now, digital assets. BlackRock‚Äôs Assets Under Management Soar to $12.5 Trillion in Q2 2025 Founded in 1988, BlackRock, Inc. has emerged as the world‚Äôs largest asset manager through strategic innovation and adaptability. From managing $69 billion in assets in 1995, BlackRock‚Äôs assets under‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/TEfNmiXXxz ‚Äî Econovis (@econovisuals) July 18, 2025 Key Milestones in BlackRock‚Äôs Ascent 1999: Public Listing BlackRock goes public. The IPO fuels expansion and innovation. It opens new capital channels. 2006: MLIM Acquisition Buying Merrill Lynch Investment Managers nearly doubles AUM. It expands global footprints across Europe, Asia, and the Americas. 2009: BGI Takeover Acquiring Barclays Global Investors brings the iShares ETF platform into the fold. ETFs become a powerhouse in BlackRock‚Äôs offerings. Market Reaction and Outlook Wall Street is buzzing. Brokerage desks are reporting a noticeable uptick in client inquiries about spot crypto ETFs, with trading floors seeing fresh waves of interest across Bitcoin and Ethereum-related products. Institutional desks are fielding more allocation requests as asset managers begin to shift weight into digital asset exposure. The tone has changed, this isn‚Äôt just a speculative punt anymore. It‚Äôs a strategic play. With regulators signaling a willingness to establish clearer frameworks around digital asset investing, a new sense of legitimacy is settling into the space. For many retail investors watching from the sidelines, it‚Äôs the massive, steady buys from asset giants that are doing the talking. The writing is on the wall. BlackRock‚Äôs aggressive positioning in the crypto space isn‚Äôt just a headline grabber, it‚Äôs a market signal. Loud and clear. When the world‚Äôs largest asset manager starts snapping up Bitcoin and Ethereum in bulk, the message is simple: crypto has moved from the fringes to the center of the financial conversation. This is no longer a niche trade for tech-savvy outliers, it‚Äôs a core allocation in a modern, diversified portfolio. What we‚Äôre seeing now is not hype-driven speculation but long-term accumulation. Quiet, calculated, institutional buying that speaks volumes. The floodgates have opened, and they‚Äôre not closing anytime soon. Disclosure: This is not trading or investment advice. Always do your research before buying any cryptocurrency or investing in any services. headline: XRP Abruptly Surges to $118,263 On This Coin Listing Platform
summary: A screenshot shared by crypto enthusiast ‚Äúyour friend, Blondie‚Äù has drawn attention within the XRP community due to a price display anomaly. The image, reportedly captured from CoinListings, showed XRP valued at $118,263 as of July 17 at 1:10 AM. In the tweet, Blondie wrote, ‚ÄúI just looked at ‚Å¶@coinlistings‚Å© and it showed $XRP at $118k!‚Äù The post rapidly gained traction, leading to various interpretations and responses from members of the crypto community. While the image clearly showed XRP ranked #3 with a trading volume of over $52 billion, the displayed price of $118,263 stood in stark contrast to its actual market value on any mainstream exchange. I just looked at ‚Å¶ @coinlistings ‚Å© and it showed $XRP at $118k! pic.twitter.com/qr5Yfi83ZT ‚Äî ùì®ùì∏ùìæùìª ùìØùìªùì≤ùìÆùì∑ùì≠, ùìëùìµùì∏ùì∑ùì≠ùì≤ùìÆ (@myfriendblondie) July 17, 2025 There was no immediate clarification from CoinListings regarding whether this figure was due to a technical error, a manipulated visual display, or another cause. Nonetheless, several users took the moment to express their views on the long-term potential of XRP and its position relative to Bitcoin. Speculations on XRP‚Äôs True Value and Role in Global Finance User Rachel reacted to the post by stating, ‚ÄúBecause it‚Äôs the real Bitcoin. Somebody is fucking with the switch.‚Äù Her comment implies that XRP may represent a more authentic or capable digital asset than Bitcoin , suggesting the possibility of intentional interference with its market representation. Another X user responded with a longer-term outlook, stating , ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if one day XRP catches BTC in price in the next 5-9 years, XRP has more value than BTC in my opinion. XRP is being used by banks and financial institutions from all over the country. I don‚Äôt really hear BTC being used by all these big banks.‚Äù This viewpoint highlights a recurring argument within the XRP community regarding the asset‚Äôs potential utility as a bridge currency in institutional payment networks, in contrast to Bitcoin‚Äôs more limited adoption within regulated financial infrastructure. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 No Official Explanation Yet from CoinListings As of the time the screenshot circulated, CoinListings had not issued a statement acknowledging the unusual display. CoinListings is a crypto price tracking platform that aggregates market data and rankings, similar to services like CoinMarketCap or CoinGecko. Anomalies of this kind are not entirely unheard of in the crypto data space, where occasional bugs or incorrect feed integrations have caused temporary misrepresentations of token prices. Whether the display of $118,263 was a bug, a backend miscalculation, or other technical interference remains unknown. There is also no indication that the figure corresponded to any real market trade or reflected legitimate exchange pricing at the moment in question. XRP Community Continues to Express Optimism Despite the likelihood that the displayed price was a mistake, the post drew renewed commentary on XRP‚Äôs long-term potential . The notion that XRP could be on the same level or overtake Bitcoin in value someday remains a persistent belief among some supporters. These individuals often reference XRP‚Äôs integration with cross-border payment systems and institutional pilots as reasons for their outlook. While the broader market did not reflect any similar valuation at the time of the screenshot, the viral nature of the image and the reactions it generated show that speculation surrounding XRP‚Äôs future remains active. As of now, there has been no further clarification from CoinListings or any confirmation that the $118,263 price was anything other than a temporary glitch. headline: ‚ÄòCrypto Week‚Äô ushers in big change: What happens now?
summary: Crypto Week in the US ends with some victories for the crypto lobby, with the GENIUS Act headed to Trump‚Äôs desk.
